sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: POSCO INTERNATIONAL and POSCO FUTURE M Collaborate to Achieve Carbon Neutrality Through Rooftop Solar Project
feed.summary: POSCO INTERNATIONAL and POSCO FUTURE M are collaborating on a rooftop solar project at POSCO FUTURE M’s Gwangyang Cathode Plant to achieve carbon neutrality and meet RE100 goals for battery materials. This initiative, which includes installing 2.2MW of solar panels to generate 2.6GWh of renewable energy annually, marks the first joint renewable energy project between the two companies. It demonstrates synergy within the POSCO Group and sets a precedent for future renewable energy expansions, including at plants in Pohang.

feed.title: Rakuten Symphony and Kyivstar Sign Letter of Intent to Deploy Open RAN to Rebuild Ukraine’s Digital Infrastructure
feed.summary: Rakuten Symphony and Kyivstar have signed a Letter of Intent to deploy Open Radio Access Network (Open RAN) technology for rebuilding Ukraine's digital infrastructure. This collaboration, which includes 4G and 5G Open RAN, is part of VEON's $600 million investment commitment to Ukraine's reconstruction. The initiative underscores both companies' dedication to supporting Ukraine's recovery and its digital future.

feed.title: Wrangler launches NFC-tagged archival pieces and connected content hub
feed.summary: Wrangler has launched a collection of vintage clothing featuring NFC tags that provide traceability and access to exclusive brand content, developed in collaboration with vintage clothing brand MNTGE. The initiative, announced by Global Creative and Concept Director Sean Gormley, aims to enrich the customer experience by sharing the brand's history and product insights, and will be expanded to Wrangler's "Reborn" archive program. This move is part of Wrangler's broader engagement with web3 technology, including previous NFT auctions and plans for more, while its parent company Kontoor Brands, Inc. recently reported an 8% increase in Q3 revenue.

feed.title: ViVE 2024: Humana taps data automation startup Veda to polish up provider directories
feed.summary: Humana has partnered with data automation company Veda to enhance the accuracy of its provider directories, aiming to improve patient access to care and reduce administrative burdens. The collaboration leverages Veda's AI platform to analyze, verify, and standardize Humana's provider data, cutting down turnaround times significantly. This initiative addresses the persistent issue of inaccurate provider information, which has been highlighted by various studies and regulatory requirements like the No Surprises Act.

feed.title: Honeywell Hits Aerospace Company With Patent Suit Over Software
feed.summary: Honeywell International Inc. has filed a patent infringement lawsuit against Lone Star Aerospace Inc., alleging that Lone Star's MaxUp software products, which provide operational analytics for aircraft, infringe five of Honeywell's patents. The complaint, filed in a Texas federal court, claims that Lone Star's software uses methods similar to Honeywell's patented technologies for monitoring aircraft maintenance and productivity.

feed.title: Gilat report "very strong 2023"
feed.summary: Gilat Satellite Networks reported "very strong" financial results for Q4 and the full year 2023, with full-year revenue up 11% to $266.1 million and Adjusted EBITDA increasing by 44% to $36.4 million. The company attributes this success to its business model, strategic acquisitions like DataPath, and significant contract wins in cellular backhaul and in-flight connectivity. Gilat also provided optimistic 2024 guidance, projecting continued strong growth in revenue and profit.

feed.title: Work Underway to Upgrade Electric System in Western Pennsylvania
feed.summary: FirstEnergy Pennsylvania Electric Company (FE PA) is upgrading its electric system in Western Pennsylvania by installing automated reclosing devices and electronic controllers in substations across Clarion, Washington, and Westmoreland counties. This $147 million initiative is part of FE PA's Long Term Infrastructure Improvement Plan II and aims to enhance service reliability for over 26,000 customers, particularly during adverse weather conditions, by preventing lengthy power outages and speeding up restoration times. The new equipment, already partially in service and expected to be fully operational by mid-year, will prevent and isolate outages more efficiently.

feed.title: Steris Stock Near Record Highs: Safe Haven Play or Priced for Perfection?
feed.summary: Steris plc (STE) has significantly outperformed the S&P 500, driven by stable hospital demand and essential infection-prevention solutions. While the stock offers defensive qualities and predictable growth, its current premium valuation poses a key risk to future returns. Investors should weigh its stability and consistent performance against its elevated price, considering it more as a steady compounder for portfolio anchoring than a high-growth opportunity.

feed.title: Cava wraps landmark year with traffic growth exceeding 10%
feed.summary: Cava Group Inc. concluded its first year as a public company with significant achievements, including an 18% increase in same-store sales and a swing to profitability with $13.3 million in net income. Despite these strong results, the fast-casual chain is projecting more modest "normalized" same-store sales growth of 3% to 5% for fiscal 2024, along with plans to open 48 to 52 new restaurants. CEO Brett Schulman highlighted the company's "investment in the guest" by largely holding back menu price increases, even in anticipation of California's fast-food wage increase.

feed.title: Callaway Paradym Ai-Smoke Max Fast Iron Review
feed.summary: This review examines the Callaway Paradym Ai-Smoke Max Fast iron, designed for golfers with moderate swing speeds who struggle with shot flight and spin. The article details how Callaway utilized Ai-Smart Faces to optimize iron performance, focusing on tightening shot dispersion and improving consistency for various player abilities. It also differentiates the Max Fast model from Callaway's other Ai-Smoke irons (Ai-Smoke and Ai-Smoke HL) by highlighting its lighter design and weaker lofts, making it ideal for slower-swinging players.

feed.title: Bloom Energy Outpaces Industry in YTD: How to Play the Stock?
feed.summary: Bloom Energy (BE) has significantly outperformed its industry and the S&P 500 year-to-date, driven by increasing demand for clean power, especially from AI-driven data centers, and a shift towards distributed energy systems. The company benefits from its proprietary solid oxide technology, R&D investments, and government incentives, demonstrating higher ROIC and strong earnings growth estimates compared to peers. Despite a premium valuation, its strong performance and unique market position make it an appealing investment, though currently rated as a Zacks #3 (Hold) due to its valuation.

feed.title: Elizabeth Chandler Sells 14,201 Shares of Rollins (NYSE:ROL) Stock
feed.summary: Insider Elizabeth Chandler sold 14,201 shares of Rollins (NYSE:ROL) stock on February 25th for approximately $842,971, reducing her stake by 20.24%. The company recently declared a quarterly dividend of $0.1825 per share, payable on March 10th. Rollins reported mixed fourth-quarter results, missing EPS and revenue estimates but showing a 9.7% year-over-year revenue increase, with analysts maintaining a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating and a target price of $66.08.

feed.title: Broadcom Sells Remote Computing Business in $4B Deal with KKR
feed.summary: Broadcom has announced the sale of its End-User Computing (EUC) unit to private equity firm KKR for $4 billion. This divestment is part of Broadcom's strategy to streamline its business operations following its $69 billion acquisition of VMware last year. The EUC unit, which includes products like Horizon and Workspace One, will operate as a standalone company under KKR, retaining its current management team and focusing on product innovation and strategic partnerships.

feed.title: Humira biosimilar from Alvotech, Teva wins FDA approval on third attempt
feed.summary: The FDA has approved Simlandi, a Humira biosimilar from Alvotech and Teva Pharmaceuticals, on its third attempt after previous rejections due to manufacturing issues. Simlandi is the first interchangeable biosimilar of the most popular Humira formulation, allowing pharmacists to substitute it directly. Despite biosimilars affecting AbbVie's Humira revenue, their market share remains low, with companies vying for interchangeability to gain a competitive edge.

feed.title: Down 6.97% to €45.77: LCR.DE Las Vegas Sands Corp. (XETRA) after-hours, debt focus
feed.summary: Las Vegas Sands Corp. (LCR.DE) saw an after-hours drop of 6.97% to €45.77 on February 26, 2026, driven by investor concerns over high net leverage and mixed free cash flow growth. Despite healthy margins, key metrics like net debt to EBITDA and debt to equity weigh on sentiment, with upcoming earnings on April 22, 2026, adding short-term uncertainty. Meyka AI rates LCR.DE as a "HOLD" with a score of 66.86/100, projecting a 12-month target price of €52.11, indicating potential upside, but advises caution due to technical signals and leverage risks.

feed.title: DaVita Leadership Conferences Offer Fresh Clues On Growth And Risks
feed.summary: DaVita (NYSE:DVA) executives, including CEO Javier J. Rodriguez and CFO Joel Ackerman, will be speaking at several major healthcare conferences in 2026, offering investors insights into the company's capital allocation, growth priorities, and approaches to the kidney care business. These appearances provide opportunities to understand management's views on care models, technology adoption, payer relationships, and how they address risks like reimbursement pressure and treatment volume variability. Investors should watch for consistency in commentary and how DaVita positions itself against competitors like Fresenius and Baxter, especially considering concerns about the company's debt being poorly covered by operating cash flow.

feed.title: Wabtec Is Up 36%. Here’s What Could Drive Shares in 2026
feed.summary: Wabtec Corporation (WAB) stock has surged 36% in the last six months, trading near its 52-week high, driven by strong Q4 2025 earnings, an expanding backlog, increased capital returns, and significant institutional investment. The company forecasts double-digit sales and EPS growth for 2026, supported by modernization programs, cost savings, and international demand. A valuation model suggests a 17% upside, indicating the stock is modestly undervalued even after its recent rally.

feed.title: Over 1,100 Evergy customers in Emporia without power
feed.summary: Over 1,100 Evergy customers in central and southern Emporia are currently experiencing a power outage, which began shortly after 10:15 am. The outage affects a wide area, including downtown, the David Traylor Zoo, Logan Avenue School, and Peter Pan Park. The cause is attributed to a vehicle hitting a pole near the First and Commercial intersection, with no injuries reported.

feed.title: First American Financial (NYSE:FAF) Hits New 52-Week High - What's Next?
feed.summary: First American Financial (NYSE: FAF) recently achieved a new 52-week high, reaching an intraday high of $69.00. The company reported strong quarterly earnings with an EPS of $1.99, exceeding expectations, and a notable 21.6% year-over-year revenue increase to $2.0 billion. Analysts currently hold a "Moderate Buy" rating for FAF, with a consensus price target of $77.67, and the company also announced a quarterly dividend of $0.55 per share.

feed.title: Fortive Corporation Announces Quarterly Dividend of $0.06 (NYSE:FTV)
feed.summary: Fortive Corporation (NYSE: FTV) has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.06 per share, to be paid on March 27th to shareholders of record on March 13th, representing an annualized yield of about 0.4%. The company has consistently increased its dividend for the past two years, with a robust payout ratio of 5.7%. Analysts have a "Hold" rating on the stock with a consensus target price of $60.85, even after Fortive exceeded quarterly EPS estimates and provided positive FY26 guidance.

feed.title: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE:TMO) Announces Quarterly Dividend of $0.47
feed.summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific (NYSE:TMO) has announced a quarterly dividend of $0.47 per share, a 9.3% increase from its previous dividend. This dividend, payable on April 15th to shareholders of record by March 13th, is well-covered by the company's earnings, with a payout ratio of about 7%. The company also exceeded quarterly earnings estimates and authorized a $5.0 billion share buyback program.

feed.title: Crown Castle Inc. (NYSE:CCI) Declares $1.06 Quarterly Dividend
feed.summary: Crown Castle Inc. (NYSE:CCI) has declared a quarterly dividend of $1.0625 per share, payable on March 31st to shareholders of record on March 13th. This represents an annualized dividend of $4.25 and a yield of 4.9%. Although the current payout ratio of 151.2% indicates earnings do not cover the dividend, analysts forecast future EPS of $6.58, which would bring the projected payout ratio down to approximately 64.6%.

feed.title: What Williams Companies (WMB)'s Record 2025 EBITDA and 2026 Outlook Upgrade Means For Shareholders
feed.summary: The Williams Companies, Inc. reported record adjusted EBITDA of US$7.75 billion for 2025 and issued a 2026 guidance of US$8.20 billion, supported by new pipeline and power innovation projects. This positive outlook is seen to enhance the company's role in serving rising natural gas demand and long-term contracted cash flows. However, the company faces risks such as faster decarbonization, stricter permitting, and high capital spending despite a recent dividend increase.

feed.title: VST: Record financials, major acquisitions, and long-term PPAs drive strong growth outlook
feed.summary: Vistra Corp. (VST) has reported record 2025 results, attributed to strategic acquisitions, long-term nuclear power purchase agreements, and strong demand growth. The company is well-positioned for continued growth due to robust cash generation, disciplined capital allocation, and significant opportunities arising from the increasing demand from data centers and hyperscalers. This positive outlook is based on insights from Vistra Corp.'s Q4 2025 audio transcript.

feed.title: The Campbell's Company (NASDAQ:CPB) to Issue Quarterly Dividend of $0.39
feed.summary: The Campbell's Company (NASDAQ:CPB) has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.39 per share, payable on May 4th to shareholders of record on April 2nd, leading to an annualized yield of 5.8%. The company recently reported Q1 EPS of $0.77, exceeding estimates, on revenues of $2.68 billion, and provided FY2026 guidance. Despite recent insider selling, institutional investors and company insiders maintain significant ownership stakes.

feed.title: Crescent Capital BDC, Inc. (NASDAQ:CCAP) to Issue Quarterly Dividend of $0.42
feed.summary: Crescent Capital BDC, Inc. (NASDAQ:CCAP) has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.42 per share, payable on April 15th to shareholders of record on March 31st, implying an annual yield of approximately 12.8%. The company announced earnings per share of $0.45, surpassing analyst estimates, and reported strong revenue of $40.8 million. Despite a high dividend payout ratio of 97.7%, the dividend is currently covered by earnings, though its sustainability could be challenged if profits decline.

feed.title: Motorola Solutions, Inc. (NYSE:MSI) Plans $1.21 Quarterly Dividend
feed.summary: Motorola Solutions, Inc. (NYSE:MSI) has declared a quarterly dividend of $1.21 per share, payable on April 15th to shareholders of record on March 20th. This represents an annualized dividend of $4.84 and a yield of approximately 1.0%. The company has a strong dividend history, having raised its payout for 13 consecutive years, with a payout ratio of 30.4% and an anticipated future payout ratio of 32.7% based on next year's EPS estimates.

feed.title: Southwest Airlines Evolves to Meet Corporate Needs with New Premium Features and Fare Options
feed.summary: Southwest Airlines is adapting its long-standing low-cost model to cater to the corporate travel market by introducing premium features and fare options. These changes include assigned seating, extra legroom, new fare bundles, reworked loyalty programs, and expanded distribution through Global Distribution Systems. The airline aims to attract higher-yield business travelers while maintaining its core commitment to affordable service.

feed.title: Tapestry (NYSE:TPR) Sets New 12-Month High - Here's What Happened
feed.summary: Tapestry (NYSE:TPR) recently reached a new 52-week high, trading as high as $161.97. This surge follows positive analyst re-ratings and a strong earnings report where the company surpassed consensus estimates. Additionally, Tapestry announced a quarterly dividend and a $1 billion stock repurchase plan, signaling confidence from management and attracting institutional interest.

feed.title: Bristol Myers says ADC licensed from China hits mark in aggressive breast cancer
feed.summary: Bristol Myers Squibb announced positive results from a Chinese study of iza-bren, an antibody drug conjugate (ADC) for advanced triple-negative breast cancer. The drug, licensed from SystImmune in a deal potentially worth over $8 billion, improved progression-free and overall survival compared to chemotherapy. This success adds to the growing prominence of ADCs, with iza-bren uniquely targeting two proteins, EGFR and HER3, found in various cancers.

feed.title: J.B. Hunt Earns Sixth Straight Best Overall Intermodal Provider Recognition in Latest JOC Survey
feed.summary: J.B. Hunt Transport Services, Inc. has been named the best overall domestic intermodal provider for the second half of 2025 by the Journal of Commerce (JOC) Intermodal Service Scorecard. This marks the sixth consecutive time J.B. Hunt has received this top ranking since the scorecard's inception in 2023. The company achieved a Net Promoter Score of 58 and a 93% customer satisfaction rate, the highest among intermodal providers surveyed.

feed.title: Pool Corporation (NASDAQ:POOL) Declares Quarterly Dividend of $1.25
feed.summary: Pool Corporation (NASDAQ:POOL) announced a quarterly dividend of $1.25 per share, payable on March 26th to shareholders of record on March 12th, resulting in an annualized dividend of $5.00 and a 2.3% yield. The company has a 15-year history of increasing its dividend, which is well-covered by its earnings. Despite missing recent quarterly earnings estimates with $0.84 EPS versus $0.99 expected, Pool Corporation provided FY2026 EPS guidance of $10.85–$11.15.

feed.title: Coterra Energy earnings loom as Devon merger reshapes outlook
feed.summary: Coterra Energy Inc. is set to report its fourth-quarter results, a key event given its pending $21.4 billion acquisition by Devon Energy, which aims to create a major shale company. Analysts anticipate an earnings per share of 52 cents on revenue of $1.89 billion, showing improvement from the previous quarter despite recent estimate pullbacks. Investors will be closely watching operational performance, capital allocation shifts towards share buybacks, and management's commentary on the integration plans and potential synergies with Devon Energy.

feed.title: Broadcom Ships Industry First 2 nm Custom Compute SoC Built on Its 3.5D eXtreme Dimension System in Package Platform
feed.summary: Broadcom has announced it has begun shipping the industry's first 2 nm custom compute SoC, built on its 3.5D eXtreme Dimension System in Package (XDSiP) platform. This technology, which combines 2.5D techniques and 3D-IC integration using Face-to-Face (F2F) technology, is foundational for next-generation XPUs and aims to meet the massive computational demands of gigawatt-scale AI clusters with unparalleled signal density, superior power efficiency, and low latency. Fujitsu is the first customer to receive this 3.5D custom compute SoC, highlighting its potential for advanced semiconductor integration crucial for AI and HPC.

feed.title: Solventum faces earnings test on growth targets after 3M spin-off
feed.summary: Solventum (SOLV) is under scrutiny as it prepares to release its fourth-quarter earnings, with analysts expecting a 24% increase in earnings per share. The healthcare company, spun off from 3M, aims to demonstrate sustainable growth, particularly eyeing its 4-5% organic growth objective by 2028. Investors will focus on new product launches, dental segment performance, the integration of Acera Surgical, and how the company plans to allocate its capital, including $1 billion authorized for share repurchases.

feed.title: Dominion Energy Charitable Foundation awards $25,000 to the Midlands Technical College Foundation
feed.summary: The Dominion Energy Charitable Foundation has granted $25,000 to the Midlands Technical College Foundation. This funding is specifically for advanced welding training programs, aiming to prepare students for careers in South Carolina's energy, manufacturing, and construction sectors.

feed.title: Omani and Jeanie Carson Named Inaugural Departure Day Dove 1 for 2026 Special Olympics Airlift, Donating Aircraft and Crew to Lead Athletes Home
feed.summary: Omani and Jeanie Carson of Omaha, Nebraska, have been named the inaugural departure day Dove 1 for the 2026 Special Olympics Airlift. They will donate their aircraft and crew to lead athletes home from the Games, a newly established honorary role. This initiative recognizes their leadership in supporting athlete travel and contributes to a broader effort involving over 100 volunteer aircraft owners and operators.

feed.title: Starlink-style satellite-to-phone lab tests: Keysight and Samsung trial LEO 5G links
feed.summary: Keysight Technologies and Samsung Electronics are collaborating to demonstrate lab-based validation of new radio non-terrestrial networks (NR-NTN) devices at Mobile World Congress 2026. This initiative focuses on testing capabilities for Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellite deployments, including Starlink Direct to Cell, to ensure readiness for satellite-to-mobile services in 5G and future 6G networks. The tests address challenges such as rapid motion, frequent handovers, and dynamic link conditions in a controlled laboratory environment to accelerate time-to-market and reduce deployment risks.

feed.title: John Deere Introduces Next Generation Tractors
feed.summary: John Deere has launched six new 8R and 8RX tractor models, featuring increased horsepower options, a redesigned structure, and enhanced performance, maneuverability, and versatility. These new tractors are equipped with advanced technology for precision agriculture, an optional peak power Intelligent Power Management system, and improved operator comfort. The updates aim to meet growing customer demand and enhance productivity for various farming operations.

feed.title: Restructuring: Viatris to cut global workforce by about 10%
feed.summary: Viatris, a pharmaceutical company with a presence in Pittsburgh, announced a restructuring plan that includes a global workforce reduction of approximately 10%. This move is part of the company's efforts to streamline operations.

feed.title: JM Smucker adds 2 board members in deal with activist investor
feed.summary: J.M. Smucker is appointing two independent directors, Woo-Sung (Bruce) Chung and David Singer, to its board as part of an agreement with activist investor Elliott Investment Management. This move follows "constructive engagement" with Elliott and comes as Smucker navigates challenges, including higher coffee prices and issues with its Hostess Brands acquisition. The company recently reported a 7% increase in net sales for its third quarter, driven by its coffee business, despite struggles in its sweet baked snacks segment.

feed.title: BKV Corp. reports Q4 adjusted EPS 29c, consensus 29c
feed.summary: BKV Corp. announced its Q4 adjusted EPS of 29 cents, meeting the consensus estimate. The company reported Q4 revenue of $330.09 million, exceeding the consensus of $260.22 million. CEO Chris Kalnin highlighted 2025 as a pivotal year, marked by significant milestones including a CCUS joint venture, the Bedrock acquisition, expanded Power JV ownership, and strengthened balance sheet.

feed.title: Electrovaya To Host Investor Webcast on March 5, 2026
feed.summary: Electrovaya Inc. announced it will host an investor webcast presentation on March 5, 2026, at 2:00 PM EST. The webcast will feature CEO Dr. Raj DasGupta and CFO John Gibson, who will discuss Electrovaya's corporate strategy, business model, and technology, followed by an interactive Q&A session for investors. This event provides an opportunity for investors to gain insight into the company's operations and future plans.

feed.title: Euroseas Ltd. (NASDAQ:ESEA) to Issue Dividend Increase - $0.75 Per Share
feed.summary: Euroseas Ltd. (NASDAQ:ESEA) announced a 7.1% increase in its quarterly dividend to $0.75 per share, payable on March 17 to shareholders of record on March 10. The shipping company's dividend is well-covered by its current payout ratio of 23.0% and an expected future payout ratio of 16.2% based on analyst EPS forecasts. Despite being down 0.4% to $62.72, the shares trade at a low P/E ratio of 3.59, implying a steep valuation discount compared to earnings.

feed.title: Simon Property Group stock hits 52-week high at $203.61 By Investing.com
feed.summary: Simon Property Group (SPG) has reached a new 52-week high of $203.61, closing at $203.62 with a market capitalization of $77.5 billion, reflecting a 14.6% total return over the past year. Despite appearing overvalued by InvestingPro analysis, the company demonstrates stability with 33 consecutive years of dividend payments and a current yield of 4.38%. Recent strong Q4 2025 earnings, significantly surpassing expectations, and a slight increase in Stifel's price target further highlight its positive trajectory.

feed.title: CDE vs. ERO: Which Mining Stock is the Better Buy Now?
feed.summary: This article compares Coeur Mining (CDE) and Ero Copper (ERO), two mining stocks, analyzing their fundamentals, price performance, and valuation to determine which is a better investment. CDE, a precious metals miner, shows stable cash generation, a strong balance sheet, and diversified gold and silver exposure with operational improvements. ERO, primarily a copper miner with gold by-product credits, demonstrates higher growth potential from record production and expansion projects, though with higher leverage.

feed.title: Dynatrace to Present at Upcoming Investor Conference
feed.summary: Dynatrace (NYSE: DT) announced that its executives will present at the Morgan Stanley Technology, Media, and Telecom Conference on Wednesday, March 4, at 2:30 p.m. ET. A webcast of the presentation will be available on the Investor Relations section of the Dynatrace website and archived for 30 days. Dynatrace is a leading AI-powered observability platform focused on transforming digital ecosystems for businesses.

feed.title: Energy Recovery (NASDAQ:ERII) Reaches New 1-Year Low Following Weak Earnings
feed.summary: Energy Recovery (NASDAQ:ERII) shares hit a new 52-week low after reporting disappointing Q4 earnings, missing analyst expectations for both EPS and revenue and setting a lower FY2026 guidance. Despite the financial setback, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus with a target price of $17.07, while recent insider sales were noted. Institutional investors have adjusted their holdings, with the company’s stock currently owned 83.58% by institutions and hedge funds.

feed.title: EPR Properties (NYSE:EPR) Reaches New 1-Year High After Better-Than-Expected Earnings
feed.summary: EPR Properties (NYSE:EPR) reached a new 52-week high after reporting better-than-expected Q4 earnings and raising its FY-2026 guidance. The company also increased its monthly dividend by 5.1%, offering an annualized yield of about 6%. Despite the positive results and recent acquisition, the REIT's significant exposure to experiential assets like theaters and entertainment venues poses a risk if consumer demand falters.

feed.title: Universal Health Services (NYSE:UHS) Stock Price Down 9.1% After Earnings Miss
feed.summary: Universal Health Services (NYSE:UHS) saw its stock price drop 9.1% after reporting fourth-quarter earnings that missed analyst expectations, with EPS of $5.88 versus $5.92 expected and revenue of $4.49 billion against $4.50 billion. Despite this short-term selling pressure, the company provided positive FY 2026 EPS guidance and highlighted improved profitability in 2025 with an 11.5% operating margin. Analysts currently have an average "Hold" rating on UHS with a price target of $234.53.
